results.headline: Searching for Mystery in Paris in 'Autumn'

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Autumn

results.summary_short: "Autumn" is a nearly perfect satire of the pretentious French thriller. Unfortunately, the movie doesn't know it.

results.headline: Comically Tormented Siblings in Heat in 'Agnes and His Brothers'

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Agnes and His Brothers

results.summary_short: The feverish libidos wreaking emotional havoc in Oskar Roehler's infantile sex comedy are a quintessentially Germanic mixture of kinky, obsessive and sentimental.

results.headline: Sexual Deviations on Parade in 'Psychopathia Sexualis'

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Psychopathia Sexualis

results.summary_short: Not even necrophilia and the imaginative deployment of leeches can relieve this exercise in unrelenting dullness.

results.headline: 'Animals and More Animals' Watches the French Give Theirs a Makeover

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Un Animal, des animaux

results.summary_short: The renovation of the Museum of Natural History in Paris is the subject for this beguiling documentary by Nicolas Philibert.

results.headline: Thunder, Rottweilers and Damien at the Zoo in 'The Omen'

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Omen

results.summary_short: When all else fails, pump up the thunder and lightning. That seems to be an operating principle behind the supremely unnecessary remake of the 1976 horror fest.

results.headline: 'The War Tapes' Provides a  Soldier's-Eye View of the Days Over There

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The War Tapes

results.summary_short: Whatever your opinion of the Iraq war, Deborah Scranton's documentary is sure to challenge your thinking and disturb your composure.

results.headline: A Supercop Vaults, Leaps and Somersaults Into the Fray in 'District B13'

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of District B13

results.summary_short: Gorgeously choreographed gymnastics of pain elevate "District B13" over the impossible missions and last stands of the season.

results.headline: Heroes and Villains Battle for the Future of Korea in 'Typhoon'

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Typhoon

results.summary_short: The largest-budgeted Korean film to date pits a snarling exile from North Korea against a strait-laced South Korean navy lieutenant.

results.headline: In Cuba, Dancing the Night Away in 'La Tropical'

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of La Tropical

results.summary_short: David Turnley's sinuous black-and-white documentary about an open-air dance club on the outskirts of Havana places passion and rhythm before politics and history.

results.headline: Food for Thought in 'Slavoj Zizek: The Reality of the Virtual'
results.display_title: Slavoj Zizek: The Reality of the Virtual

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Slavoj Zizek: The Reality of the Virtual

results.summary_short: The Slovenian intellectual of the title sits in front of a camera and does nothing but talk. And talk.

results.headline: 'Woodenhead': A Freakish Fairy Tale From New Zealand

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Woodenhead

results.summary_short: In "Woodenhead" Florian Habicht latches onto the Tilt-a-Whirl moment and tries to extend it to an hour and a half.

results.headline: Obstacles Line the Road to Self-Discovery in '50 Ways of Saying Fabulous'

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Fifty Ways of Saying Fabulous

results.summary_short: Set in rural New Zealand in the summer of 1975, "50 Ways of Saying Fabulous" follows a chubby 12-year-old as he embarks on a wearisome journey of sexual discovery.

results.headline: 'The Cult of the Suicide Bomber' Studies the Bliss of a Terror Tactic
results.display_title: The Cult of the Suicide Bomber

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Cult of the Suicide Bomber

results.summary_short: An engrossing if intellectually thin documentary that purports to explain how suicide bombing evolved from a weapon of war into a weapon of terror.

results.headline: In 'The Break-Up,' the Odd Couple Buys Real Estate. Complications Ensue.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Break-Up

results.summary_short: Vince Vaughn and Jennifer Aniston play a couple on the splits in a desultory modern version of the classic comedies of remarriage of the 1930's and 40's.

results.headline: From Belarus, Indelible Portraits of Power's Absolute Corruption

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Long Knives Night

results.summary_short: In a pair of fiercely critical documentaries, the Belarussian director Victor Dashuk casts a cold eye on Aleksandr G. Lukashenko, the president of the Republic of Belarus.

results.headline: 'Coastlines': Part Crime Drama, Part Soap Opera in the Florida Panhandle

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Coastlines

results.summary_short: Enough of the ingredients for a sultry downscale noir are in place in "Coastlines," that once the film turns perversely goody-good, it leaves you feeling vaguely disgruntled.

results.headline: 'Fanaa,' a Film About Love and Terrorists

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Fanaa

results.summary_short: This supercharged romantic musical from Bollywood goes so far over the top it reinvents itself halfway as a thriller about Kashmiri radicalism.

results.headline: 'Cavite' Is a Tale of a Terrorist Group by Guerrilla Filmmakers

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Cavite

results.summary_short: Terrorism and cultural identity are only two of the themes wound into a tight knot of fear and bewilderment in "Cavite," a gripping no-budget political thriller.

results.headline: 'X-Men: The Last Stand' Asks Are Mutants Born or Made, and Should They Be Cured?

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of X-Men: The Last Stand

results.summary_short: As might be expected, "The Last Stand" pretty much looks and plays like the first two "X-Men" films, though perhaps with more noise and babe action and a little less glum.

results.headline: A Teenage Playboy Chases Secrets From the Past in 'Shem'

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Shem

results.summary_short: An insufferable teenage playboy is sent on a wild goose chase to locate his great-grandfather's grave in Caroline Roboh's half-baked drama.
